subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
subSections.text:
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|缶詰|かんづめ}}: [[canned]] food; [[confinement]] for a particular purpose
* {{ja-r|缶詰業|かんづめぎょう}}: the [[canning]] [[industry]]
* {{ja-r|缶詰業者|かんづめ ぎょうしゃ}}: a [[canner]], someone who [[cans]] as a [[business]]
* {{ja-r|缶詰工場|かんづめ こうじょう}}: a [[cannery]], a [[canning]] [[plant]]
* {{ja-r|缶詰食品|かんづめ しょくひん}}: [[canned]] [[food]]
* {{ja-r|缶石|かんせき}}: [[scale]], [[lime]] and other [[deposits]] left behind in a [[boiler]], [[kettle]], or similar device
* {{ja-r|缶切り|かんきり}}, {{ja-r|缶切|かんきり}}: a [[can opener]]
* {{ja-r|缶胴|かまどう}}: the [[boiler]] of a [[steam engine]]
* {{ja-r|缶焚き|かまたき}}, {{ja-r|缶焚|かまたき}}: [[minding]] a [[boiler]] [[fire]] for a [[steam engine]]; a [[steam engine]] [[fireman]], [[tender]], or [[stoker]]
* {{ja-r|缶偏|かまへん}}: the [[Chinese character]] [[radical]] consisting of the {{m|ja|缶}} character
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text: Originally from {{etyl|nl|ja|sort=かん}} {{m|nl|kan||cylindrical metallic container}}, with additional influence from {{etyl|en|ja|sort=かん}} {{m|en|can||cylindrical metallic container}}. The kanji is an example of {{ja-ateji}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text: From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かま}} ''kama'', signifying a container for high heat and referring variously to a {{m|en|hearth}}, {{m|en|oven}}, {{m|en|pot}}, {{m|en|kettle}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|かま}}

# a [[boiler]], as for a [[steam engine]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: For the {{m|en|boiler}} sense, this term ''kama'' is most often spelled using the kanji {{lang|ja|缶}}.
